text: Philippines at the Olympics is a history which includes 23 games in 16 countries and 370+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Philippines" ; retrieved 2012-7-27. Since 1911, the Philippines has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-27. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for the Philippines is PHI. ==History== The Philippine National Olympic Committee was formed in 1911. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1929.Olympic.org, Philippines; retrieved 2012-7-27. Philippines's team first competed at the 1924 Summer Olympics in Paris. The team did not compete in the 1980 Summer Olympics. Filipino athletes have also been at the Winter Olympic Games three times after 1972, but not since 1994. The Philippines is the first nation in the tropics to be in the Winter Olympic Games. ==Medalists== ===Summer games=== Medal Name Games Sport Event 1928 Amsterdam Swimming Men's 400 metre breaststroke 1932 Los Angeles Athletics Men's high jump 1932 Los Angeles Boxing Men's bantamweight 1932 Los Angeles Swimming Men's 200 metre breaststroke 1936 Berlin Athletics Men's 400 metre hurdles 1964 Tokyo Boxing Men's featherweight 1988 Seoul Boxing Men's light flyweight 1992 Barcelona Boxing Men's light flyweight 1996 Atlanta Boxing Men's light flyweight 2016 Rio De Janiero Weightlifting Women's 53 kg 2020 Tokyo Weightlifting Women's 55 kg 2020 Tokyo Boxing Women's featherweight 2020 Tokyo Boxing Men's flyweight 2020 Tokyo Boxing Men's middleweight ===Summer Youth games=== Medal Name Games Sport Event Luis Gabriel Moreno 2014 Nanjing Archery Mixed Team ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites == * Philippine Olympic Committee website * Philippines profile at London2012.com Category:National sports teams of the Philippines Olympics Category:Nations at the Olympics
